block.p: Theresa Frances Washington, a daughter of Fannie Mae and Frank Washington of Corona, Queens, was married yesterday to Kevin Leon Gaines, a son of Lucille and Leon Gaines of Queens Village, Queens. The Rev. Dr. Marvin J. Bentley performed the ceremony at the Antioch Baptist Church in Corona.

Mrs. Gaines, 31, is the Webmaster for PhoneFree .com, an Internet company in Manhattan whose software enables users to make telephone calls via personal computer. She graduated cum laude from New York University, from which she also received a master's degree in interactive telecommunications. Her mother retired as an assistant chef at the Better Community League, a day care center in Corona. Her father retired as a motorman for the Metropolitan Transit Authority in Manhattan.

Theresa Frances Washington, a daughter of Fannie Mae and Frank Washington of Corona, Queens, was married yesterday to Kevin Leon Gaines, a son of Lucille and Leon Gaines of Queens Village, Queens. The Rev. Dr. Marvin J. Bentley performed the ceremony at the Antioch Baptist Church in Corona.

Mrs. Gaines, 31, is the Webmaster for PhoneFree .com, an Internet company in Manhattan whose software enables users to make telephone calls via personal computer. She graduated cum laude from New York University, from which she also received a master's degree in interactive telecommunications. Her mother retired as an assistant chef at the Better Community League, a day care center in Corona. Her father retired as a motorman for the Metropolitan Transit Authority in Manhattan.

Mr. Gaines, 33, is the controller and a senior research analyst for ACAM Advisors, an asset management business in Rye, N.Y. He graduated from Norfolk State University in Virginia. His mother retired as an assembly worker in Valley Stream, N.Y., for the Bulova Watch Corporation. His father, also retired, was a bus driver for the M.T.A. in Jamaica, Queens.
